intro: Cotylelobium leucocarpum, commonly known as the white-fruited cotylelobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive white, fleshy fruits that mature in dry seasons. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, often arranged in dense inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
